page.title: 18Transport in Knockholt
page.content: Most people in Knockholt are car owners. Many families have more than one car. Teenagers have motor bikes. The bus service is very limited. The 471 runs every two hours to Orpington, the nearest town and railway station. There is a service to Sevenoaks, but the last bus back leaves at 5.40pm. Special buses take children to school in Sevenoaks, Tonbridge and Tunbridge Wells. Children stopping after school for sports or clubs have to rely on parents to fetch. Children who attend the Primary School walk or are taken by car. They are allowed to cycle when they have passed the test in Cycling Proficiency. All the Knockholt roads are minor ones and are affected by the winter weather; lanes are often blocked with snow. Nearby are the A21 and the new M25 Motorway giving quick access to London and the South coast.
